body: I see you fit the waypoints to a 3rd degree polynomial. This may be the source of the radical MPC trajectory changes that cause the car to veer off-road during sharp turns. Have you tried using a 2nd degree polynomial?

Notice the simulator reports speed in miles per hour, however the MPC works in meters (the unit of car coordinates `x` and `y`) and seconds (time step durations are given in fractions of a second). Consider converting speeds back-and-forth between simulator and controller.
